title.narrative: CROSS SECTORAL PROGRAMMING

description.narrative: The 2019-2023 Programme of Cooperation includes emergency preparedness and response, communication, monitoring & evaluation, gender equality, climate change and fundraising as cross-cutting issues to foster the achievement of program planned results., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Evaluation, Evaluation (Covid), Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The 2019-2020 Programme of Cooperation is conducted with efficiency and efficacy, strengthening sectorial programming, program coordination, external relations and communication.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The 2019-2023 Programme of Cooperation includes emergency preparedness and response, communication, monitoring & evaluation, genderequality, climate change and fundraising as cross-cutting issues to foster the achievement of program planned results.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF made significant progress in institutionalizing the volunteering strategy, and strengthening the activity monitoring capacities of implementing partners. Progress was also made in supporting national institutions to generate up-to-date statistical data on children and adolescents, starting the implementation of the MICS, and generating strategic information on investment in children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2022
